page.title: 05THE "DIPS" AT NEW BRIGHTON
page.content: On summer days the Dips on King's Parade are full of people - though they never seem crowded. If there is a breeze, stunt-kites whirl in fantastic loops and dive over games of cricket and football and multi-coloured tents spring up to complete the holiday picture. In winter the Dips are very different. They are bleak and windswept with few people to be seen. Sometimes strong winds and high tides combine to produce towering waves which thunder against and over the sea-wall, flooding the summer playgrounds which become mini marine-lakes. It is to be hoped that the new sea defences, financed by the E.E.C. and complete this year, will prevent flooding of the Dips in the future.
